title: Resignation of CFO and Appointment of Interim CFO & Ongoing Operations
head_office_address: No. 12 Ihama Road, G.R.A, Benin City, Edo State
detailed_summary:
### Summary of Corporate Disclosure Document for Ellah Lakes Plc

#### Purpose and Nature of the Disclosure
This document serves as a corporate disclosure from Ellah Lakes Plc, detailing the resignation of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), the appointment of an interim CFO, and updates on the company's ongoing operations.

#### Key Dates
- **December 7, 2022**: Date of the disclosure regarding the resignation of the CFO and the appointment of the interim CFO.
- **End of January 2023**: Expected commissioning date for the 3 Ton Per Hour Crude Palm Oil (CPO) Mill in Edo State.

#### Key Personnel
- **Robert Grant**: Former Chief Financial Officer of Ellah Lakes Plc, resigning to pursue other opportunities.
- **Dipo Ogunbiyi**: Appointed as the interim Chief Financial Officer. He has over 18 years of experience in investment banking and finance.
- **Olumoroti Alli**: Company Secretary, who signed the document.

#### Background of Interim CFO
- **Experience**: Dipo Ogunbiyi has extensive experience in capital markets (equity and debt) and mergers & acquisitions (M&A) in sub-Saharan Africa, advising on transactions exceeding **US$2 billion**.
- **Previous Roles**: He was the head of investment banking at First Ally Capital and has worked with other notable investment banks including FBNQuest Merchant Bank, Renaissance Capital, United Capital, and FCMB Capital Markets.
- **Education**: Holds a BA from Lagos State University and an MBA from the University of Chicago, Booth School of Business.

#### Company Operations
- **3 Ton Per Hour Crude Palm Oil (CPO) Mill**: The mill located in Edo State is expected to be commissioned by the end of January 2023, which will initiate cash flow from the company's operations in that region.

#### Company Overview
- **Ellah Lakes Plc**: A Nigerian agribusiness specializing in the cultivation of Oil Palm, Cassava, and Soybean across Edo, Enugu, and Ondo States.
- **Stock Exchange Listing**: The company was listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) on **January 14, 1993**.
- **Community Impact**: Ellah Lakes Plc aims to empower local communities and is diversifying its operations across various agricultural value chains, including Oil Palm, Cassava, Maize, Rice, and Soybeans.

#### Contact Information
- **Website**: [www.ellahlakes.com](http://www.ellahlakes.com)

This summary encapsulates all significant information from the corporate disclosure document, including personnel changes, operational updates, and company background.
